localizeDatas.inspector.PreserveBorderEdges.tooltip: If the border edges should be preserved.
localizeDatas.inspector.PreserveUVSeamEdges.tooltip: If the UV seam edges should be preserved.
localizeDatas.inspector.PreserveUVFoldoverEdges.toolti: If the UV foldover edges should be preserved.
localizeDatas.inspector.PreserveSurfaceCurvature.toolt: If the discrete curvature of the mesh surface be taken into account during simplification. Taking surface curvature into account can result in very good quality mesh simplification, but it can slow the simplification process significantly.
localizeDatas.inspector.EnableSmartLink.tooltip: If a feature for smarter vertex linking should be enabled, reducing artifacts at the cost of slower simplification.
localizeDatas.inspector.VertexLinkDistance.tooltip: The maximum distance between two vertices in order to link them.
localizeDatas.inspector.MaxIterationCount.tooltip: The maximum iteration count. Higher number is more expensive but can bring you closer to your target quality.
localizeDatas.inspector.Agressiveness.tooltip: The agressiveness of the mesh simplification. Higher number equals higher quality, but more expensive to run.
localizeDatas.inspector.ManualUVComponentCount.tooltip: If a manual UV component count should be used (set by UV Component Count below), instead of the automatic detection.
localizeDatas.inspector.UVComponentCount.tooltip: The UV component count. The same UV component count will be used on all UV channels.
